intro: Coutaportla pailensis, commonly known as the Paila orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and striking, fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are often pale pink or white, with intricate patterns that attract specific pollinators. Due to habitat loss, Coutaportla pailensis is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
